Reviews.Title: The Best 15.6" Ultrabook Touchscreen at its Pricepoint
Reviews.Author: ProfessorF
Reviews.Content: I own three of the latest tablets/laptops and this is by far the best of the bunch in terms of balancing power, weight, and usability.  The other two laptops I own are a Microsoft Surface Pro (too dinky and unstable) and a core-i7 Dell w/ a maxed out graphics card (too big and heavy).Before I begin the technical part of my review, let me say how I use my computers.  As an information systems & digital media professor I use my computers for basic tasks like writing papers, lecturing, and presentations.  With it's 15.6 inch touchscreen, it's perfect for those.  However, as part of my research and teaching, I also use my computers for programming, 3D modeling, animation, visual effects, digital inking, and video production.My computers need to be powerful enough to not only run Microsoft Office, but Adobe Photoshop, After Effects, and Premier, as well as Autodesk Maya, and the Visual Studio programming environment.Rather than just list features I'll describe why I feel the ASUS is better than my other computers.Why the Asus is better than my Surface Pro: Both the Surface Pro and the Asus S550CA have core-i5 processors running at the same speed.  The Surface Pro has better screen resolution (1920x1080 vs 1366x768).  HOWEVER, the Surface packs 1080p into an 11 inch screen, which is too small to use especially in desktop mode where it's hard to touch the tiny icons.  I find the ASUS's 1366x768 *perfect* for selecting icons in desktop mode.  Of course the Surface Pro is more portable, but you pay for that portability.  It only has a single USB 2.0 port, whereas the ASUS has 2 USB 2.0 ports and a USB 3.0 port.  The ASUS also has a VGA port, which is still the standard when you're hooking up to projectors.  If you want to hook up to a VGA projector on the Surface, you need to buy a $40 adapter.  So to summarize, the ASUS is just as powerful, easier to use in terms of the touchscreen, and has better connectivity.Why the ASUS is better than my maxed out Dell: the Dell's too heavy and gets too hot.  Yes, when I need speed for my apps and when I want to play games I use my Dell with it's quad-i7 and discrete graphics card.  But the Asus is fast enough for all the applications I mentioned and I only notice the lack of power when I render videos & animations--not while I'm creating them.Anyway, I don't want this review to get too long. I want to end by saying that I compared the features of my Asus to other ultrabooks at the same price point like the Acers, HPs, and Lenovos, and what I found, to my surprise, was that these other ultrabooks were missing the DVD writer and the VGA port that my Asus had.  You may not need these features, but they're important for what I do.Bottom line: Highly Recommended!

Reviews.Title: Good balance of cost and quality
Reviews.Author: Clayton James
Reviews.Content: I purchased this s550 vivobook from Costco a few weeks ago. I got it from Costco because the assurance if I do not like the item, I can return it (up to 90 days, was it?).I had an HP DV6 6119wm before I Got this laptop. I purchased the HP a year ago and was so upset with the quality and lack of HP backing their own product, I actually just decided to sell it and get a new one.Things certainly changed since a year ago. Most of the laptops now are touch screen and with windows 8, which when I was at the store I had to spend about 20 minutes just trying to get used to how to navigate windows 8.  The touch screen was nice and it had 10-key which I need. It's fast enough and light with a sleek design that is not cheap looking like some laptops in this price range are.The good:Slim, light and ample amount of ports including VGAHas optical drive and card reader10-keySSD makes for SUPER fast resuming.Quiet! this laptop is very quiet and that is very nice to have.The bad:The 10 key is nearly useless because the arrow keys actually take up space within the 10-key's real estate. I REALLY hate this. The ZERO key should be horizontal and twice the size, the shift/ctrl keyes should be made smaller and the arrow keys should take up the rest of that extra space to make this a PERFECT 10 for me, but since these design mistakes are there it's just shy of that for me.The ugly:Battery life is so-so, but then when you see how big the battery is you'll know why. I don't need to be mobile and i'm almost always near an outlet but it would be nice. Perhaps I could play with the settings to increase this?The touchpad is too far to the left. It would be nice if the divider of left/right click was raised because unless I look at the pad, I often times are clicking to far to the right and end up right clicking, problems I haven't had with other laptops.The 6GB of memory is the max this line can take and that is terrible. My last year's HP DV6 I maxed out to 16gb. 6GB seems oftly small of a limitation for new hardware.In short, this laptop is a good buy for the price. You get a lot of features and I don't feel like i'm missing much.

Reviews.Title: value for money
Reviews.Author: Sush
Reviews.Content: I have owned an Asus laptop previously (a 2007 model) and used several HP laptops in the recent past. I will be basing my review on my experiences with these and the Asus S550C.The Asus S550C looks beautiful with it's aluminum finish and is light weight. the screen is very nice and bright and colours are correct with good contrast. The touch screen is very nice and responsive. I feel the touch screen is an excellent feature to have if you are running windows 8, as the apps work beautifully with that and closing an app is easily done using the touch screen. (in case you are not familiar with win 8 apps; they do not have a close button like the windows programs, and always run fullscreen. to close an app you have to left click at the top of the screen and drag the curser to the bottom of the screen. this is not easy if you use the touchpad only.) Plus this being a laptop, you don't have to hold the screen up with one hand.The laptop is very very fast, 10 second bootup from shutdown, and 2 second wakeup from sleep. Core i5 is very powerful. 6GB RAM is more than adequate. the sound is good and loud. (Some HP have ALTEC LANSING speakers that do a better job though.). And has one USB 3 port, HDMI out port, which are all very useful.But...it is not without drawbacks either. The screen has a gloss finish and is reflective (not a major issue though). If you touch the Alumunium cover with oily hands, it will get print marks and these are really hard to remove. The camera is crap compared to HP. (this is just like the one I had in my 2007 model with poor low light performance and bad in backlit conditions.) the DVD drive open button need to be pressed quite hard to open it. The touch pad is slightly mal-aligned (probably in my copy only) and the SD card slot is under the power/charging light set and you have to tilt the laptop up to see it. And to see the SD icon you need to turn the laptop upside down (Initially I thought this was a defect in the cover until I realized it's the SD slot. the SD slot is not marked in the manual either!!!!). There is only one jack for headphone and mic. So if you have an old headset with one jack for speakers and one for the mic, you need to choose which is more important to you , or buy a new headset. The keyboard is not good. the feel of key-press is not good and sometimes the key gets half pressed and you miss a letter. the HP laptops had better tactile feedback and the keys feel more precise. I think even my old ASUS had better keys.If you can live with these limitations this laptop is a very good buy for you. It would be best for you to try out a few laptops at your local store before deciding on one. And do compare the keyboards before buying as it may be a game changer if you do a lot of typing.

Reviews.Title: Bad experience
Reviews.Author: AcAdemist
Reviews.Content: I have purchased my ASUS S550C almost 5 months ago. It looks beautiful with touch screen and sturdy structure. But it has one big design flaw which renders this beautiful notebook completely useless. It shuts down randomly (by hardware) unexpectedly with no warning. First I thought this was a specific problem with my machine, but then it became apparent that I was not the only unlucky ASUS customer experiencing this due to a "Northbridge" chip design problem.ASUS maintenance did not even bother answering my emails.So now I have a beautiful notebook that I can not use it for anything serious like bank transactions because you don't know when it is going to crash. (By the way it is happening quite frequently.)My advise to you, stay away from it.My advise to ASUS, you are hurting your company reputation badly. People like me will never buy another ASUS again.

Reviews.Title: This is my notebook of choice!
Reviews.Author: Andre Choquette "BorderBuyer"
Reviews.Content: Okay, already own hmmm over 8 notebooks ranging on the small side: Viliv N5, Lenovo ThinkPad Tablet 2 10.1" 64GB Win 8 Pro Tablet (367927U), Alienware 10 inch notebok and Apple MacBook Air MD760LL/A 13.3-Inch Laptop (NEWEST VERSION). On the mid size Samsung Series 9 NP900X3E-A02US 13.3-Inch Full HD 1080p Premium Ultrabook and Apple MacBook Pro MD101LL/A 13.3-Inch Laptop (NEWEST VERSION) and on the large size Alienware M17x R4 AM17xR4-8424BK 17.3-Inch Laptop (Stealth Black with Soft Touch Finish),Sony VAIO Tap All-in-One Touchscreen SVJ20217CXW 20-Inch Desktop (White) and 17 inch Macbook Pro.However, for appointments where I need to meet with clients and do anything other than book and appointment or take notes (where the Lenovo ThinkPad Tablet 2 10.1" 64GB Win 8 Pro Tablet (367927U) is used).The size of the Asus Vivobook is a little larger than your standard 15 inch notebook (15 x 10.5 verse 14 x 9.5 for my Samsung Series 9 NP900X3E-A02US 13.3-Inch Full HD 1080p Premium Ultrabook) but not to big for most notebook bags (but perhaps check the size specs).I would suggest the ASUS VivoBook S550CA-DS51T 15.6-Inch Laptop (Black) instead of the ASUS VivoBook S550CA-DS51T 15.6-Inch Laptop (Black). Only differance is that the ASUS VivoBook S550CA-DS51T 15.6-Inch Laptop (Black) has a CD/DVD drive.As far a boot speed, good. Not the quickest but not the slowest but lets remember SSD and HDD configuration instead of straight SDD drives.Keyboard layout is slightly smaller than normal but I am a 6'3, 210 lb male with large fingers and no major problem - takes a bit to get used to to using the numerical keypad and the numerical keypad keys are slight smaller and closer together than normal.Love the number of USB ports, hate notebooks with only two ports (Apple take note)!So the Pro's and Con's:Pro's:-Fast boot time from SSD-Good Memory size-Numerical keypad (for anyone in the numbers business this is key)-Bright clear screen-Touchscreen - have to keep reminding myself that I can touch the screen)!-Trackpad, actually not bad - love the vertical line on the bottom to let me know left and right sides - very smart!Con's:-Slightly smaller than normal keyboard-Screen resolution - would love to see higher resolution but understand that limits with touchscreens-Would love full SSD version.-Would love to see higher memory configurations.Basically, I keep on the leading edge of technology and when it came to looking for a slim notebook that includes everything (touchscreen, numerical keypad, SSD, slim size), this notebook was the closest on the market.Hopes this help :)

Reviews.Title: Great computer with a few minor issues.
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: When I fist picked up the computer after receiving it, I was like "wow! is that it?"  I've never had a computer this thin.  It didn't feel like a normal laptop in my hands.  I really like how thin and light it is.  The display is great.  (personally I don't need super high-definition or anything like that)  The almost edge to edge glass gives the screen a nice look.  It is definitely built to last being made almost entirely out of aluminum.  The underside is plastic but the keyboard area and top are all aluminum.  The silver aluminum around the keyboard resists marks and fingerprints wonderfully!.  The dark aluminum top is a different story.  Fingerprints easily show up when touching any part of the top.  This of course doesn't affect the performance in any way, you just have to be cleaning the top often for it to continue to look nice.  I've only had the computer for a few weeks but I give it a hard use.  I teach online, use it for entertainment, etc... basically everything.TOUCHSCREEN - If this were a windows7 computer the touchscreen would be useless, but since this comes with windows8 I love having the touchscreen!  Windows 8 takes some getting used to, but the touchscreen makes it so much easier.  Also the smart trackpad is awesome.  You have to learn the different gestures it accepts which are different from a normal laptop trackpad.  If you are used to using touchscreen phones, etc. it will be super easy and it really adds to the windows8 experience.  Having a glossy screen, it does get fingerprints on it easily, but the computer comes with a nice cloth that cleans them off in a few seconds.KEYBOARD - The keyboard is ok, nothing special.  Several other people have mentioned that sometimes you think you've pressed a letter but it doesn't show up.  This happens to me too, but less and less as I am getting used to the amount of pressure I need to apply to the keys.PERFORMANCE - The computer is decently fast.  I haven't noticed any lagging so far.  Be sure to turn off automatic updates, or it will obligate you to restart no matter what you are in the middle of doing every once in a while.  Twice while watching Hulu it restarted by itself for no apparent reason.  It hasn't done it since though, so I'm not sure what that was about.  While teaching I will have multiple programs open at the same time (blackboard collaborate, browser with up to 8 windows open, gtalk, powerpoint, word and skype) and it continues to work perfectly.  The i5 processor and 6gb ram do a great job for what I need it.COOLING - Tons of laptops have issues overheating.  My last two were HP's which had tons of problems overheating.  I'm not sure how Asus does it but this computer stays supercool!  I've never heard the fans running, even on high performance with all my programs open.  The aluminum stays cool and only sometimes will it feel slightly warm.  I love this aspect of it.SPEAKERS - The speakers are oddly positioned on the bottom of the computer.  I couldn't figure out why but, regardless they work great.  They are louder than any other laptop I've ever owned, however when turned up past 80-90 the sound quality starts to suffer a little and I think it could damage them if used often at those levels.  Where I live there is a lot of ambient noise and with my last laptop(15.6" hp)unless it was the dead of night I would almost always have to plug in extra speaker.  Since buying this laptop I've only had to do that once or twice.I would definitely recommend this laptop to almost anybody. It's a well-built, fast performing laptop especially for this price! Windows 8 needs a review of it's own.  I don't mind it and think it has some nice features especially with the touchscreen.

Reviews.Title: Definitely work the  money. Impressive Laptop.
Reviews.Author: Lm Nlandou-tchibindat "Kashile"
Reviews.Content: I wanted to say that as someone who has owned multiple laptops in the past, none of them can beat this one.I was very hesitant to buy this laptop because of bad reviews on windows 8 but since I am the type of person who likes to see, test and review for herself I thought "Hey, why not give it a try myself and if I don't like it...well what can be worse than my last laptop dying on me after only a year of use, right ?"Pros and cons:At first I was very surprised at the finish and body of the product, it seems to be made of aluminium, this stuff seems resistant to random falls or hits, it gives the impression that it can withstand any blow (I wouldn't try to drop it on purpose though...just for the sake of finding out if it can lol).Aesthetically, the aluminium finish makes this laptop look very posh, I feel like I own a Lamborghini in the form of a laptop. The design is just plain gorgeous.The thing is, for an ultrabook I was expecting something lighter than a regular laptop but this laptop is heavy, no joke ! Compared to my previous laptops, this is the heaviest laptop I have owned (It's probably because of the aluminium finish).The other thing that pleasantly surprised me is the size of the laptop screen and bottom part, is this  laptop really a 15.6 inch laptop ? Nope, it's slightly bigger than this, I compared it to my old vaio 15.6 inch laptop and the asus is a lot bigger, the screen is wider, and the quality of the screen better.The touch-screen is so responsive and amazing, My little sister owned a lenovo touch screen laptop and because the touch wasn' very responsive I was afraid to buy a touch screen laptop but I was very pleased with the asus touch screen, I barely use the mouse now. It makes accomplishing tasks so much easier.I'm not too fond of the keyboard though on my old laptops I just had to press the keys lightly for them to respond, with this keyboard you have to somehow apply full pressure for the keys to respond, it's annoying for people like me who type quite fast because of that I like to use the on-screen keyboard instead.The speakers...when I first opened my laptop, I did not pay attention to the speakers, I like to listen to music while drawing and working, my last laptop had poor speakers not to say the least, so when I decided to put some music I was not expecting the next thing that happened. The music blasted out of the speakers so loud and clear that my little sister and I were taken aback, shocked and panicked because my mum was asleep next door and you could hear the music from miles and miles...ok, not that far but you get the point.The integrated camera is also good for a webcam, the quality is better than most laptops' webcams I have used so far.Overall, only positive things to say about this ultrabook. Asus has done great on this one.

Reviews.Title: Thin and not THAT heavy...an ultrabook that has good functions.
Reviews.Author: KIM
Reviews.Content: PROS:-I am so particular with the weight, since I travel a lot, and I carry my laptop so I can do my work anytime, anywhere. I am not disappointed coz with all the functions i.e. optimal drive, and great cooling fan (no noise at all), the laptop is light as what I expected. Compared to my former one HP..its optimal drive was the culprit..making it heavy.-Cooler...battery does not overheat. I can put it on my lap, still will not make any complaints about it.-Touchscreen-easy to navigate, the glass monitor is really amazing...I am not worried w/ scratches (unless I use diamond fingernails)-Thin-I like my 15.5" monitor..does not look big at all, but I don't have to totally constraint my eyes.CONS-Keyboard is not user friendly---I type the best I could, but I have to retype some letters...perhaps I need to key in the letter a little bit hard, than the usual way...? I prefer a soft touch keyboard-Mouse Pad---have to press harder if I want the left or right button-LAN Port does not hold the cable properly. It has to have a lock otherwise, it keeps on falling.***Overall....I give it a 4star. Maybe you think I did not go in depth with my review..which is true, because I am not a techy. I can only share the experiences I have in my Vivobook. It is obvious that, if I want to have THE perfect laptop, then I must go for a HIGHER END/PRICE..which is not in my budget. I am happy with ASUS VIVOBOOK...

Reviews.Title: Great pc for price!
Reviews.Author: LishiaT
Reviews.Content: I love this laptop! The touch/mouse pad is very responsive & easy to use, and the touchscreen is great as well. Its not too weighty & is very thin. Only complaint thus far is battery can tend to go faster than I like but overall great ultrabook for the money.

Reviews.Title: Top of the line quality
Reviews.Author: Donald Morris
Reviews.Content: Again Asus came through with great quality at a low price. Other brands can't come close to the specs for the money, if they even offer the same product. I have had several high end computers and this rates up there with them.

Reviews.Title: Keeps Turning Off
Reviews.Author: Mary
Reviews.Content: It keeps unexpectedly turning off. Tech Support has tried to help, but now I must pay to ship it back to them for repair or hopefully, for replacement. I have lost data due to the unexpected turnoffs. There is no warning, it just quits like someone turned off the switch on a light.

Reviews.Title: Computer works very well, fast, convenient, good looking.
Reviews.Author: MikeR
Reviews.Content: Good deal for the money.  Don't use touch screen all the time but nice to have it there when you want it.

Reviews.Title: Works great. I love the touchscreen.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Rayne"
Reviews.Content: Keyboard is a bit awkward to get used to.I love the touchscreen! Battery life is good.I am very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Great Laptop but...
Reviews.Author: Staypositive2
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love the look, fit, and finish of the ASUS VivoBook S550CA-DS51T.  It's pretty amazing that the overall thickness of this laptop is under an inch and yet it has a DVD R/RW drive. Battery life and the performance are on par per the price. The one thing I'm not crazy about is the operating system Windows 8. To me at least, Microsoft took a step back compared to Windows 7 only because its more complicated; not as familiar as the previous versions. I've read some of the low rated reviews that gives this laptop a bad wrap because of how complicated it is to navigate. It's not Asus's fault...blame Microsoft's Windows 8. Other than that, I'd definitely would recommend this laptop.

Reviews.Title: Works great
Reviews.Author: Fred
Reviews.Content: I purchased this machine for what it had, not what I wished it would have.  It is very quiet, doesn't get hot, battery life is amazing, and it has lightening fast boots from sleep and hibernate.  What I wish it had was better resolution, back-lit keyboard and lighter weight, but as I said it does what I bought it for beautifully and I have no problems with it.  Windows 8 apparently doesn't have native CD/DVD support so most machines don't come with them. This one does and I love to have it there and Asus has included utilities for using it. Exterior finish will not stay without fingerprint marks. I wish there was a potential to purchase Win8 Pro with the machine rather than Win8 (home), since I would like to use Win8 Hyper-V available in Pro and Enterprise only, so I will be upgrading shortly.Getting used to using Windows 8, but I still hate the crap out of it. Hoping 8.1 would resolve a lot of the hatred.  I recommend the machine to anyone but will make sure they understand the limited screen resolution, which I think is the biggest drawback, although not a deal-breaker (hence my rating of 4 stars). I suppose a higher resolution screen would have cost another $200 or so, and the question is "would I have been willing to pay $200 more for a better resolution?". Answer would probably be "No".  The thing is if you are going to use the Win8 in the Metro mode, the resolution is fine. But if you want to go to desktop mode and use it as you used Windows 7, you will feel the need for better resolution.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely the best choice I could have made
Reviews.Author: Carrie Lorentz
Reviews.Content: I will keep this short and sweet. I looked for over a month for a laptop with all the qualities I wanted and this one fits them all.I wanted a touch screen so I could learn and use all the windows 8 functions. I am not techy but am willing to learn. Since it is hard to get used to windows 8 I immediately went to you tube and watched several videos going through the various functions of windows 8 and the touch screen. I then downloaded new start tab which let's you use the laptop like windows 7 while I am learning the new system. Download it here. [...]I use my laptop for at lest 16 hours per day it is always on and using multiple windows, working from home. it is smooth, fast and reliable. I have had no issues. The only thing I was surprised to find later was no place to insert my camera SD card. Bummer, and my portable usb device isn't being recognized when I plug it into transfer pictures that way...may be something I have to look at with windows 8.I was also hoping to get a laptop with a backlit keyboard and this doesn't have one but it wasn't a priority. Just thought I would mention it since I don't think it is shown in the description.

Reviews.Title: Lasted 3 months
Reviews.Author: Top of Maine "Maine Forester"
Reviews.Content: This product lasted about 4 months and then stopped working.  First it would only run when plugged in and shortly thereafter it would not start even when plugged in.  The battery had a 98% charge.  Amazon advertised this product as having the best warranty around; false.  I had to pay the shipping to the service center and that was $30.  I emailed ASUS and they said the customer should pay the shipping.  If you advertise the following, you should honor the terms:Relax, ASUS has got you covered!This notebook is backed by the industry's most comprehensive coverage:1-Year International Warranty*30-Day Flawless Display Guarantee*Free 2-way standard shipping*24/7 Technical Support1-Year Accidental Damage ProtectionCovers accidental drops, spills, power surges and fire damage for the first year.For more information, visit http://completewarranty.asus.UPDATE:  ASUS responded and said yes I was covered by warranty and I was told where to send all of my information.  I did twice and have had no response from ASUS.  I will not give up though.  I will start writing to the Better Business Bureau and other agencies soon.  I would think Amazon would take notice when companies do not honor their commitment for warranty work.

Reviews.Title: This is a cheap Ultrabook.  Should have known better
Reviews.Author: Bill
Reviews.Content: I bought this from Costco in March 2013.  May 2013 the connection in the hinge starts to go and I can only open the lid 1/3 of the way or hook it up to an external monitor.  ASUS requires the customer to pay ($60 with Ins) to ship the laptop back to them even though it is THEIR product that is faulty.  10 days later I got it back.  Worked fine for another 3 months.  Now it's starting to have the same issue again.Apart from that, the laptop just feels cheap.  fit and finish is poor.  CD rom drive works but does not fit cleanly in the side of the laptop.  Touch pad has a bigger gap on one side that the other.  It's just poorly made.  My opinion is that ASUS cheaped out on design and components to have an inexpensive ULTRA Book.  There is nothing ULTRA about it except ULTRA annoying.I've contacted ASUS and Costco to see if someone will make it right.  If ASUS takes care of the problem, I'll come back and update my review.  As of now, I would not take this laptop for free if you need something dependable.It's unfortunate because ASUS came highly recommended to me.

Reviews.Title: Great buy, great price
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Perfect for my needs, great buy for the price i paid for it. Not too many alim laptops now adays that carry an optical drive. This one tops it all.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Richard J Blair
Reviews.Content: Only have had it one week.  A gift to my granddaughter who just graduated from H.S. and needs a computer for college.  She lovesthe quality of the screen, the sound system and the touch screen.  Hope it will continue to be what she wants.

Reviews.Title: Great purchase!
Reviews.Author: Eleftheria Tsatsos
Reviews.Content: I was going to buy the 14'' non touch screen version of this laptop from my local BJs until I saw this one on amazon. For an extra $70 I added a bit of size to the screen and the touch screen capabilities. It's great, I love it so far! The design is sleek, the keyboard responds great, and overall the laptop functions well with windows 8. The only down side is that it weighs like a normal laptop, although it is skinny like a notebook.

Reviews.Title: Good product with a Excellent service from Amazon
Reviews.Author: Yohan Plavartala
Reviews.Content: Really impressed with amazons service. Happy that they delivered it before the time. Its been just two day since ive used the laptop and im sold on it. Good boot-up speed and good build quality. lets see its performance over the next few months...

Reviews.Title: ASUS VivoBook S550CA-DS51T 15.6-Inch Laptop Review
Reviews.Author: tim231020
Reviews.Content: I have only owned my ASUS computer for about two weeks.  So far I haven't had any problems except for the following:1. The touchpad sometimes takes extra strokes to respond to the given command.  For instance, when you tap the pad with both fingers it is the equivalent of right-clicking the mouse.  However, this feature does not always respond on the first few trys.  Sometimes it does not respond at all and I have to click the right button on the pad.  Not a huge deal, but the product should consistently do what it is built for.2. The touchscreen has similar flaws.  For example, it doesn't always respond to the swiping action from the far left side of the screen to the right.  This action is equivalent to the alt+tab feature on windows which alternates between programs that are open.  Again, no big deal, but it should work consistently.Beyond the stated flaws, everything else is great.  The touchscreen is a great feature, the weight, dimensions, processor, 6GBs of RAM, and 500GBs of hard drive space are a great deal relative to the price.  Also, ASUS has the most consistant ratings for reliability in laptops across multiple surveys.  Overall, I'm very happy with the purchase...so far.  Of course, time will be the best judge of reliability.

Reviews.Title: The jury is still out
Reviews.Author: Ellen B. Mainiero
Reviews.Content: The Asus VivoBook had good reviews, which is why I bought it.  For the first 3-4 weeks, I couldn't maintain a consistent connection to the internet, and after trying everything under the sun to get it to work, I was about to send the thing back.  But then one day discovered a screw where I was sitting (it had fallen off the bottom of the laptop)... replaced the screw, and things have been better.  Guessing the loose hardware was causing flaky connectivity.Things have been better for the last week or so... the touch screen is great, Windows 8 would not have been my first choice, but I'm getting use to it.  Will give it another month before I decide to keep it, or give it to my son.

Reviews.Title: Nice computer, but hate the new Windows!
Reviews.Author: Capuchen
Reviews.Content: I like the computer, but the new Windows is very confusing.  Trying my best to get used to it!  I heard that they're working on a new one to simplify things. Can't wait for that to come out. I'll be first in line to download it! :-)

Reviews.Title: Simply Great
Reviews.Author: Oswaldo Cardona
Reviews.Content: Good Speed response, decent graphics performance, slim, good design, the dimension is like a 17'' screen, a good choice, for a really good price.

Reviews.Title: Very Pleased
Reviews.Author: WILLIAM MCGILL
Reviews.Content: Nice Design and fair features for the price. I would have payed a couple of bucks more for a back-lit keyboard.

Reviews.Title: does everything i want it to
Reviews.Author: Lawrence A. Zuppan
Reviews.Content: fastdon;t use the screen use a mousetoo many pop upspicture and sound are greatall in all I am fully satisfied

Reviews.Title: Good blend of featues and value
Reviews.Author: Anonymous
Reviews.Content: Daughter using it for college and took to Windows 8 fairly easily.  Computer is light weight, holds a charge about average, comes with a DVD drive(fairly uncommon for a slimmer unit), and has a bright and responsive touch screen.  Only issues thus far are related to Window 8 and not an ASUS issue.

Reviews.Title: Works great
Reviews.Author: Doug Hyatt
Reviews.Content: I have had no problems with this computer very good and stable computer. Only problem i had was getting use to Windows 8 and figuring out all the settings.

Reviews.Title: WIFI ISSUES....
Reviews.Author: Jorge Torres
Reviews.Content: So I bought this laptop for some light gaming and for college, and its grown on me the last couple weeks, and a pretty great machine all around. I gave it 3 stars, however, for a couple of issues I've been having with it.PROS:LightweightHas touchscreen allows for much easier navigation through Windows 8The graphics card and processor are strong enough to run Far Cry 3, Tomb Raider, Call of Duty, Battlefield 3, and a ton of other games on low or medium settings.Boots up insanely fast Very stylish, reminiscent of the Macbook line.CONS:Bad wifi reception (this is killing me, i only get two to three bars in my room, whereas my old Toshiba laptop gets 5. I did some research and came to the conclusion that because of the metal body, It doesnt pick up the signal as well as the plastic toshiba. Still, VERY annoying.)Fingerprint magnet on both the inside and outside, I literally clean it every day so it looks nice when I use it.All in all, great value machine for the price, but the wifi thing is killing me and I'm slowly getting used to it.

Reviews.Title: The best laptop for this kind of money
Reviews.Author: Javier M. Y.
Reviews.Content: it does everything a 1k dollar laptop does, it looks decent on the outside, the best looking feature for the outside is the really small height with exactly 2cm, wich is a BIG difference if you never owned an ultrabook before and you are used to a regular laptop, which looks extremely bulky after looking at this one.On the inside, it really feels like actual metal, actual aluminium, not just like a hard and coldish plastic, the entire design of the inside reminds me of a macnook pro, which is also pretty damn nice, a LARGE trackpad wich alowes cool asus gestures super usefull in windows 8, a full keyboard with a numPad, and a bunch of leds to show info about everything u want a led for.Performance wise, it started out a lil slow but i figure out it was just because it was installing updates and stuff on the backorund, after a few days, its a bullet. i used to have a Lenovo i3 wih 8 gigs of ram, and this is far from that experience, its super fast.the touhscreen is even more responsive that i thought it would be, and the edge to edge glass design makes it that much confortable to use on a daily basis.all n all, every one of these features combine perfectly wit W8, and i dont think i could even stand windows 8 without all these nice features like the large gesture enabled trackpad, the touchscreen, the edge to edge glass and confortable keyboard.i would suggest every single one of my friends to go for this pc,  i never had a lenovo and had my doubts about resale value and stuff like that because i supossed that it was a low end manufacturer, but turns out that several of my geeky friends love the brand and have nothing but good things to say about it, go for it.

Reviews.Title: Very good laptop
Reviews.Author: Uma Maheshwaran "Umamaheswaran"
Reviews.Content: I am running Eclipse and Visual Studio on this laptop and it never slowed down. Very silent, does not heat up and touch screen is responsive. Easy to carry around. Very happy with the purchase. (Does not like Windows 8 though but have installed a utility which brings back the start menu )

Reviews.Title: Really wanted to like it.
Reviews.Author: KB
Reviews.Content: My main problem was with the wifi and the touchpad.  The wifi would randomly drop the connection.  I could sit there with my phone and/or ipad right next to the laptop and they would be connecting fine.  Couldn't find drivers that would work.  Also the "touch" aspect of the touch pad seemed to come and go.  Sometimes it would work fine, other times it didn't seem to recognize that I was touching it.  That was pretty annoying.  I ended up returning it.  Like I said, I really wanted to like it, but ultimately I was disappointed.

Reviews.Title: recommended
Reviews.Author: MMLIU
Reviews.Content: cool, fast, light for a 15'6but i need time o get used to win 8so far so good

Reviews.Title: Amazon Great!, ASUS Warranty Horrible
Reviews.Author: tacotoy
Reviews.Content: The laptop itself works great, the battery died after 4 months of light use and after that would only run while plugged in. I contacted ASUS about this 3 weeks ago with no response, so I located another replacement battery here on Amazon and suddenly the laptop works great again. I have contacted ASUS again to see about getting a replacement battery, or a refund, but with the awesome response I have had so far, i'm not holding my breath.

Reviews.Title: Please help with this question-
Reviews.Author: KBChicago
Reviews.Content: What is the difference between this model 'DS' and another vivobook the 'ES' model (this is the Cost co model)The asus website offers no details...but there's a $100 diff in cost...help please.

Reviews.Title: It's only just enough to be Okayish.
Reviews.Author: A. Muttaki
Reviews.Content: I use it to run Solidworks and other mid range software. I despise windows 8. The touch screen is an afterthought or bandwagon feature that doesn't lend any increased capability or functionality. The angle at which you would interact is harsh and very uncomfortable (hover your hand 6 inches off the desk, and half an inch from the screen and you'll see it's awkward). In my opinion as an industrial designer with user interface/experience experience: touch screens are the new bandwagon bull stuffer feature like fingerprint readers and color screens were in the past (does your oven need a color screen? It did for a year or so when miniaturized color screens became available)The volume is controlled by a pair of buttons, "FN" and "F11 or F12". The spread between these three buttons is 7 inches. Too bad since these buttons have to be pressed at the same time. The SD card slot is located on the underside chamfer of the front end. So inserting a card often requires me to lift the laptop so I can catch that underbite of a card slot.This laptop is a mid-level market filler. It has no real purpose other than to fill a spot between budget and high end. I do like the aluminum housing (even though it's clammy and moist after a minute of contact with my palms).

Reviews.Title: I regret buying this Asus notebook
Reviews.Author: airchamp "ariel"
Reviews.Content: It comes with Windows 8 OS which I have still to find useful.The touch screen works well enough, but that's all that is good about it.It has the worst keyboard and I find letters and words jumping all over my sentences.It is so bad in fact I had to buy the Dragon voice recognition software because I  constantly had to review and correct what I was writing.At times I am so frustrated with this machine that I go to my old Acer laptop which was much cheaper and less powerful, but works more efficiently then the Asus.I will never buy another product from this company again.

Reviews.Title: Overheats
Reviews.Author: D. Fatheree
Reviews.Content: I've had this computer for around 8 months. I am a college student, and obviously need a dependable computer. Earlier today, it decided to overheat and won't even turn on now.This is the first computer I've ever had this happen to. I was under the impression ASUS made good products, but after today I will be reconsidering my electronic choices.I am absolutely livid, and it just had to happen right before finals week.

Reviews.Title: I like my ASUS Laptop!
Reviews.Author: F. Beckett
Reviews.Content: I've had it for about 5 months now. It had all, but one of the features I was looking for. (It's not backlit!) When I purchased it, it was the best price I could find for the features I wanted. My CC company offers a service that checks for a better price anywhere on the internet and after 30 thirty days they didn't find it at a better price. I purchased this one at Amazon. I like the separate 10-key numeric pad.  I still getting a little use to Windows 8.1, but it's not hard to adjust to it. The computer was easy to use right out of the box!

Reviews.Title: Hardware look, feel and performance are stellar
Reviews.Author: Carla
Reviews.Content: I received my ASUS Vivobook a little over a month ago.  It meets and exceeds my expectations in almost every category.Pros:--The laptop itself feels fairly high quality.  I love the brushed aluminum finish on the keyboard and wrist rest.--The touchscreen is bright and colors vivid, though the viewing angle is a bit smaller than I would like.--The speed!  My old laptop was...well let's just say very old, so the speed of the processor on this ASUS is a breath of fresh air.--It is light and feels sturdy.--The battery life so far has been around 4-5 hours, this works just fine for me.--Optical DVD Burner drive was a must for me, even though they say they are on their way out.  The base of the laptop is still only around half an inch thick, even with the drive built in.--Almost no bloatwareCons:--The lid is black plastic and it is a fingerprint magnet.  I have gotten used to wiping it down with a microfiber cloth every time I pick it up.  I love the look of the laptop when it is clean and wish that using it did not immediately leave it smudged with oils from my fingers.--The trackpad mouse is not very responsive on a single or double click.  This was mentioned in several other reviews and I hoped it would not turn out the be the case, but luckily I tend to use an optical mouse and this circumvents the problem.  It becomes frustrating very quickly when the pad does not respond to taps.--The speakers are nothing special, they sound slightly tinny and occasionally muffled.--Window 8I know the Windows 8 debate is already old and tired but I have to say I have never been more disappointed with a piece of software or an Operating System in my life.  It is not intuitive and requires a pointless jumping back and forth between the "old style" Desktop screen and the new Apps screen.  In the beginning the design was confusing and frustrating enough for me to set aside my brand new laptop for several days (something no gadget geek ever wants to do) and now after almost a month is waning towards simple annoyance instead.  Learning the swipe tricks and other "shortcuts" has helped a bit, and yet I still find myself longing for Windows 7 instead.  Before purchasing and using Windows 8, I thought surely those who couldn't make it function must be older, non tech types.  I consider myself rather tech savvy and it is still more hinder than help to use this system.All in all, a few personal tweaks (optical mouse, bluetooth speakers instead of built-in, and installing Classic Shell to make Windows 8 more navigable) have taken this computer from fairly decent to great and I look forward to using it for some time.

Reviews.Title: love this laptop!
Reviews.Author: felicia
Reviews.Content: my laptop had broken so i had to search for a reasonable priced laptop that had everything i wanted. i wanted a thin laptop that still have a cd drive and i finally found this one ! only thing it didnt have was a finger scanner but i can live without it. this product is even touchscreen, dont use it much but its a plus ! only con i have is that the smart gesture center sometimes doesnt work when you close the laptop and reopen it so you cant scroll with the touchpad, but when you restart it, it works again !

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Awesome product for the price touch screen works extremely well and fast booting is a plus to say the least.

Reviews.Title: Done after 5 months
Reviews.Author: L. Meadows "Meadows"
Reviews.Content: 5 months and now it won't turn on...from reading online, it probably overheated and fried the motherboard...seems like that happens often, not just to me. I will try the warranty and update my review accordingly.

Reviews.Title: Quick but huge
Reviews.Author: Jill
Reviews.Content: I like it start speed, which only need like 15 seconds. However it is really heavy and big to carry.

Reviews.Title: Good price for a good system....
Reviews.Author: Lauren L.  Henderson "Lauren"
Reviews.Content: Up and coming solid brand with great value for the money.  Great system for everyday computing.  Two of my three kids owns an ASUS computer or tablet and are both very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Great computer
Reviews.Author: Dustin
Reviews.Content: Well i am a mac guy and had to buy a pc to run some work specific programs.  I am really impressed with this computer especially at the price point.  Windows 8 is a bit wonky but the computer itself is fast surfs the web and plays solitare like a champ!!  I am not a gamer nor do i run complex programs.  The touch screen is cool and easy to use no complaints on the screen or keyboard.  I will definitely buy another asus brand computer if the need ever comes up.

Reviews.Title: Love it, it works great and is very light
Reviews.Author: Scott Horrigan
Reviews.Content: Its nice to have a laptop that I can trust.  Asus is a very good name brand every desktop unit I build is a Asus motherboard so I really count on this company all the time.Now the touch pad is very sensitive so I would recommend a Logitech Marathon Wireless mouse with the Unify technology to go with the unit.Also installed Linux Mint 16 which runs great on this system and is more effecient than Windows 8.1, and the software is free too. [...]

Reviews.Title: Excellent notebook value
Reviews.Author: John Larson
Reviews.Content: Very pleased.  Truly a 'full sized' Ultrabook, I am very happy with every aspect of this product.  The audio, with speakers on the bottom side, is the most limited feature and, as expected, if you want real quality sound you will want to connect external speakers.  Otherwise, performance, design, etc. - this has delivered as expected.

Reviews.Title: Excellent laptop - good value
Reviews.Author: Anthony P
Reviews.Content: Exactly as described and just what expected. Ran great right out of the box, touch screen is very responsive. Limited installed software, but that was clear upfront and I already had a MS 2013 office licence. Doesn't feel heavy or bulky despite its larger size.The core-i5 processors runs fast, quiet and smoothly. The ASUS has 2 - USB 2.0 ports and a USB 3.0 port. It's is fast enough to run multiple applications with minimal performance change. The DVD may be an option not all buyers want, but at this price-point its a great additional feature.The only draw backs so far are the tendency for the touch screen to pick up every bit of oil or debris from fingers, marginal battery life and a very average camera.Those few "minor" challenges are the only things keeping from giving it 5 starts ... really think it deserves 4 1/2.

Reviews.Title: Overall review
Reviews.Author: amf "amf"
Reviews.Content: Overall a good laptop, windows 8 a bit psychotic trying to be both a laptop and tablet.  Best of both worlds

Reviews.Title: Like it
Reviews.Author: nitehawk
Reviews.Content: Comes with Windows 8 which takes a bit getting used to. Computer was easy to set up. Instant on feature is great. I am using it as a desktop replacement and the 15 inch screen size is fine. Would definitely recommend this computer, especially given it's price and features.

Reviews.Title: Asus VivoBook
Reviews.Author: Diane Caldwell
Reviews.Content: I really like this computer. It is nice and slim with good resolution. I definitely like the number keyboard on the right.

Reviews.Title: I love my Asus!
Reviews.Author: Donna L Tworek
Reviews.Content: The Asus is slim and attractive to look at.  It is fast and has everything that I require in a computer.

Reviews.Title: tight design
Reviews.Author: tau hus
Reviews.Content: So far so good. At times I experience slowness in performance but after proper shutdowns it goes back to normal. I have to agree with other comments, graphics are not the best to watch movies and stuff. Oh, after using ipad and my galaxy s4 for normal browsing this laptop feels way too heavy. However considering the size of the screen the weight seems alright.  Have nit tried blue tooth yet. Wifi works fine no connection drops. All in all happy with the product. I paid 607.00 right before thanksgiving via Amazon and didn't see much drop in price since then.

Reviews.Title: Good HD monitor and apps
Reviews.Author: Ezra
Reviews.Content: but next time i'll buy, i'd prefer a real laptop, and not like a tablet laptop. its still awesome though

Reviews.Title: A beautiful laptop that is plagued with problems.
Reviews.Author: Lalala
Reviews.Content: I don't really hate this laptop. I think it is cosmetically appealing but man the problems! I've had the laptop for almost 4 months. The wifi on my unit is horrible. It drops service all the time on reliable networks that simultaneously I have a perfect connection on my ipad and iphone. Neither of those devices have ever dropped signal whereas dropping signal is typically a multiple times a day problem with this laptop. The laptop does randomly restart once in a while and this wouldn't be too big of deal to me if it didn't take 15 minutes to restart when this happens. The biggest problem I worry about popped up today. In the middle of the screen a splotchy circle popped up that refracts the picture. It's only about half an inch as of now but I'm concerned there's something wrong with the screen and the problem will just grow. I'd love to be contacted and have this problem fixed because I do want to love this product!

Reviews.Title: ASUS vivobook
Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: I love it! This is the best laptop I'll ever purchased. I couldn't find this in the stores but found it on Amazon.

Reviews.Title: touch screen is great!
Reviews.Author: Bob  Kamphuis
Reviews.Content: The laptop is a bit heavy and the instant on was sluggish at times.  Doesn't come with MS office suite and only a 30 day trial of MacAfee.  The touch screen is great!  I wouldn't deal with WIN8 without touch screen.  The number pad on the key board was a great change on a laptop.  I touchpad is awkward.  I kept hitting the right button instead of the left.  It seems misplaced.

Reviews.Title: Overall is okay.
Reviews.Author: Rex
Reviews.Content: Window 8 is not user friendly and require a lot of patient. The screen resolution is so so. The rest are good.

Reviews.Title: Fast Delivery and Perfect Conditions!
Reviews.Author: Eleonora Rios Alonso
Reviews.Content: I received the Product even sooner than I expected and it was perfect! Just the way the seller described it, I'm very happy and I reccomend this seller with eyes closed! The computer is working fine and the touch screen is awesome, thanks for everything!! I'm enjoying my new purchase as much as I can and I will continue shopping through this web site! Honestly happy and thankful!

Reviews.Title: Love this computer
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "wendy bird"
Reviews.Content: OK - I decided to buy this computer with Windows 8 even though my boyfriend works in IT and I know that it's really annoying not having a start button.  However, I was able to figure out (all on my own) how to get to the area where you can restart your computer (admittedly it took me 1/2 hour) but I'm not reviewing Windows 8.This computer is excellent.  It's lightweight (for it's size) and the lightest computer I have ever owned.  I absolutely love having a touch screen which I use for the mouse but not for typing.  The keyboard has a nice feedback although I will say it took me a little bit to get used to the keys and what pressure was needed. It has a full keypad along with number pad and separate arrows.  It did take a while to get used to where the arrows are and where they put the home, page up, page down, end keys.  It doesn't have a separate insert key so that can be a bit annoying.I use it for work every day and don't use it for watching videos or gaming but I think it has an excellent display (which I clean regularly to remove fingerprints).It feels like a solid computer.  It's fast and turns on quickly.

Reviews.Title: Perfect laptop for gift to my son - it's beautiful and runs very well
Reviews.Author: Barbara Russell
Reviews.Content: giving this to my son for Xmas and he's already seen it and loves itHe's an apple user and likes Windows 8 touchscreen very muchthe asus is goo quality and easy to use - ordered a smaller one for myself

Reviews.Title: Nice but a little heavy
Reviews.Author: John Abbott
Reviews.Content: A little heavy but functions very well.  The two second delay to come out of hibernation is very convenient.  A good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: Good product so far
Reviews.Author: Isidoro Couvertier
Reviews.Content: Bought it for my daughter.  It was easy to set up and the programs I have installed in it have so far worked without any problem.  It powers up in about 3 seconds!

Reviews.Title: great ultrabook
Reviews.Author: ah249
Reviews.Content: Maybe not light enough to be called ultrabook.touchscreen is very responsive. Window 8 has a bit of learning curve. The laptop itself is great. Resolution is not as good as my old Samsung and speaker is not great but for the price, it is very good value. Great for home use. Pretty fast even when running a few programs at the same time.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Diego
Reviews.Content: Excelent laptop. Very light very fast. I love it. And the price is excellent. I'll buy another for my wife in no time.

Reviews.Title: Great laptop!
Reviews.Author: Laurie Hoffman
Reviews.Content: Very happy with the overall laptop.  It's a little heavier than I expected, but not anything to ruin my rating.  The only thing that I would have to "con" about is the key board.  The keys are a more spread out than I'm used to.  If I had bigger hands it would work, but I don't.  The keys are a lot thinner than other laptops as well.  It's a new style than I'm used to.  Other than that over all quality is great.  Touch screen works great, very responsive, boots up quick, for the most part it's quiet (the cooling fan isn't to bad),.  It does not get hot, so that's good.  I'm happy with it and if anything changes I'll update.

Reviews.Title: Better than my last laptop
Reviews.Author: Felicia Hernandez
Reviews.Content: It arrived a day earlier. Yay! It has a nice screen and it looks sharp. However, the layout of the trackpad and keyboard are a bit big for my hands. It did freeze a couple of times and the touchscreen did not work for a few hours. It's weird but I noticed it starts up faster than it did when I got it a week ago. Overall, as a college student I would recommend this. If you want something a little more portable though I would probably get something a little smaller, but that is just me.

Reviews.Title: Great Laptop
Reviews.Author: Techguy
Reviews.Content: I got this Laptop for college and it has been a great choice. ASUS lives up to its reputation with this one. The only reason this computer has been given 4 instead of 5 stars is that this computer comes with an older generation i7 processor that's a bit dated. However by no means is this slow. The computer is instant with most tasks and the 2sec boot time is wonderful. Definitely recommended!

Reviews.Title: Great laptop
Reviews.Author: Patrick Verst
Reviews.Content: Windows 8 works well on this touchscreen laptop.  However, with this touchscreen comes a very reflective screen.  In dark rooms, the screen works very well.  Everything is very visible.  However, in bright rooms, the screen is very reflective.  Sometimes, you can see yourself, the sun, the lights, etc. better than you can see what's supposed to be displayed on the screen.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Laptop in the segment
Reviews.Author: Paresh Patel
Reviews.Content: Prosgood features, responsive touch screen, worth the priceConsFound bit slow taking windows updatesOverall excellent buy for the price range

Reviews.Title: Great value, great looks and processing power
Reviews.Author: Sanjay Srivastava
Reviews.Content: PROSGreat priceFunctionality and price sweet spotGreat looking machineCONSHeavy (desktop replacement)Some software on it not needed

Reviews.Title: The college boy loves it
Reviews.Author: timhief
Reviews.Content: My son need a thinner, lighter laptop to carry to his classes at the University.  He found this one and we purchased it.  The battery life is superior and the touch screen is a natural fit for how he does things.  It has 8GB of RAM so it performs well, he's very happy with it.  This i the second ASUS I've purchased and couldn't imagine being more satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Awesome the whole way around
Reviews.Author: Justin Pavkovich
Reviews.Content: Awesome laptop. Awesome service. Awesome Price. No complaints what so ever, all the wifi issues everyone is complaining about is so dependent on their surroundings and how they are using the laptop. No wireless issues at all. 5 stars for sure

Reviews.Title: Don't Buy Windows 8 unless installed on "touchable" device
Reviews.Author: Jimbo "Help Desk"
Reviews.Content: The laptop boots up and about 20 seconds and comes out of sleep in like 2 seconds. It seems solidly built. Battery time appears to be around 3 hours of continual use all though I haven't tested this yet.I had used Windows 8 before but only on non-touch devices and too be honest I wasn't impressed. Using Windows 8 on a touch screen (this model has a touch screen) makes Windows 8 much better.So far I'm very pleased with this laptop.

Reviews.Title: Great laptop
Reviews.Author: Maude's book review "moyamul"
Reviews.Content: This is a great laptop with plenty of memory. Very speedy start-up with the 24 gb solid state drive. Slim & portable with the best of Asus tech. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: Arrived on time and works well.
Reviews.Author: Tgay
Reviews.Content: Windows 8 takes a bit getting use to but the laptop is really great. The battery life isn't the best but it doesn't bother me very much A great buy!

Reviews.Title: Great product!
Reviews.Author: Frank de Castro
Reviews.Content: Fantastic!  Great price, good quality materials used.  Super fast and light weight. I use it for work and gaming and it works perfect .

Reviews.Title: I love this computer!
Reviews.Author: E. Clark "TraumaTrae"
Reviews.Content: For its price, this is easily one of the best ultrabooks in the market.The only issue I've had with it, is that every now and then you have to disconnect and reconnect to your WiFi, but that's an incredibly minor issue

Reviews.Title: Great laptop for the money
Reviews.Author: Jeffery Van Fleet "JVF"
Reviews.Content: It took me a few days to get used to Windows 8, but now I really like it. This laptop has everything someone would want, except for a backlit keyboard. The battery life is great, the screen is easy to see, and everything else works well. I would but this laptop again, infact, I may buy one for my wife and she is using mine more than ever now!

Reviews.Title: The note is very good!!!
Reviews.Author: ADRIANO GOMES CESAR
Reviews.Content: The notebook is very good... I'm still trying to adapt to Windows 8 and finding some limitations related to Win 8... but other than that, even my 2 years old godson loved!!!

Reviews.Title: great touch experience
Reviews.Author: Doron
Reviews.Content: I love the touch interfc it works perfectly, the laptop is also very quick.It is heavier than I thought and came with no booklet on how to use all its functions

Reviews.Title: Nice Surprise!!!
Reviews.Author: Sarah
Reviews.Content: When I purchased this, I had semi-low expectations, but when I opened the packaging, it was surprisingly thin and sleak. I LOVE the finishing on the laptop, it looks so modern. The speakers are also AMAZING. Better than I expected. It's been running like Usain Bolt since I have gotten it. Love the Windows 8 also..Don't get me wrong, I LOVE this laptop, but this is coming from a person who had a $200 Lenovo for 3 years, so I might just not be used to nice computers.You should seriously get it, then do the free trial for Amazon Prime and get free 2 day shipping. It requires a credit card, but once you place your order, you can immediately change the settings so when the trial is up, it won't charge it to your credit card and you will just have normal Amazon again. :)

Reviews.Title: could not be more pleased!
Reviews.Author: L. Braswell "calm spirit"
Reviews.Content: The best notebook I've ever had by far. Great construction, keyboard, touchscreen, warranty, I can't say enough about how this meets my needs for basic computing, school, and my business.

Reviews.Title: New and great adventure!
Reviews.Author: lovekrazee
Reviews.Content: I've always stuck with HP for pc and laptops purchases, but I have found the ASUS VivoBook touchscreen laptop a joy, along with Windows 8 it is a great adventure.  Loving every minute of every day on this laptop.

Reviews.Title: Still learning!
Reviews.Author: C. Teicheira "The Reader"
Reviews.Content: I love the touch screen - after all my phone is a touch screen - and this is just an natural extension of that.  I wish there had been more "How To"s that came with the computer.  I love the size, it is very lightweight, and kinda sexy - if a computer can be sexy.  I will update this review when I have had more time with the computer.  So far, so good.

Reviews.Title: Not a bad laptop for Ubuntu 13.04 users
Reviews.Author: Chris Lee
Reviews.Content: Use this primarily for my work desktop. Wifi doesn't work so i had to buy a belkin adapter. The battery life is a bit on the poor side. But i stay plugged in for the most part. It could use more ram. Sometimes when using a virtual machine the laptop slows down a bit.I wish they offered a non touchscreen version of this laptop. The style and build of the laptop is of good quality. It's sleek mac inspired look with it's sharp gorilla glass makes it a good laptop to show off work.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Carol Zemen
Reviews.Content: This laptop exceeded my expectations with its ease of setup.  This laptop was well worth the price I paid on Amazon.

Reviews.Title: What a waste!  Waste my time and money!!
Reviews.Author: Justin Knaus
Reviews.Content: Well I ordered the Package and everything, came in on time and everything, but when I opened it, it just wreaked of fishiness.  The Asus box had the bar codes for parts all covered up and there was NO package receipt in the box AT ALL.  I though that this was alright, as long as the computer would work. BUT IT DIDN'T WORK AT ALL!  The computer battery charged and I followed all start up instructions and awaited the start up.  Pressed the power button and the screen lit up.  Not even 2 seconds later the computer blanked out, the battery light was still on.  I guess that was a sign that it could still work, so my sister took a look at it since she worked with a lot of Asus computers and she has the same exact computer.  She took a look at the battery and tried to start it again 3 more times, the same result.  We concluded that there was a faulty in the power connection from the start up module.  In the end, A GIANT WASTE OF TIME!  On top of that, I have to pay for return shipping because the product had an error.  If you're gonna get this computer, please order from another seller, save yourself the trouble.

Reviews.Title: You're kidding? I returned it.
Reviews.Author: Annette M. Weintraub
Reviews.Content: I chose this product because I needed a second laptop for my job. I have had 2 other ASUS laptops and I love them. The new one I ordered never worked properly. It contained Windows 8 so was supposed to have a touch screen but that never worked. I couldn't get it to shut down correctly. The vendor and Amazon were kind enough to let me return it.

Reviews.Title: Touchpad broken out of the box and Crash, crash, crash!
Reviews.Author: Jimbo Billy Bob
Reviews.Content: I have had this laptop for 6 days now. It has been one problem after another, to where now I'm hesitant to even turn it on, let alone try to do any work on it. That's why I'm composing this review on my old computer.First the good:It's a good looking laptop and on first appearances seems well made. Nice keyboard. The touch screen is very smooth and with a little investigation online (not much help from ASUS or Microsoft) you can figure out how to do pretty much every thing you can do with a mouse or a touchpad.The bad:When I first opened the laptop I noticed that the bottom of the touchpad (the side closest to the user) was slightly bowed up in the middle. Upon trying to use the touchpad, I couldn't get either the left or right "buttons" to work at all. You can use it to move the pointer around the screen and to double-click icons, but there's no way it can be used to access context sensitive menus that can only be reached with a right-click.The worst part is it repeatedly crashes. It has crashed when using Internet Explorer, it has crashed when moving start screen tiles, it has crashed when there's no activity at all, and it has even crashed when the Charm bar "shut down button" is touched. By crashed I mean it just seizes up. Dead as a brick. Even Ctrl+Alt+Delete does nothing.When these crashes occur, the only way to shut down is by holding down the keyboard power button. In one instance, on restart it did a full system recovery (without warning) which took over an hour and deleted every I had done on it since taking it out of the box. Two other times it "rebuilt the profile" (whatever that means) which is about a 10 minute process. Then each time I would have re-download the 44 patch from Windows Update. Sometimes, but not always, after restart the McAfee antivirus would not automatically load and would have to be started in the Control Panel.I have not heard of Windows 8 being this unstable, so I assume the problem is either this particular laptop (infant mortality) or perhaps some incompatibility between this model laptop and Windows 8.This has been a most aggravating experience.I presently plan to return it to Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Nice computer but not good for work - Random Shutdowns
Reviews.Author: Phillip Bruce Rittgers
Reviews.Content: About once a week, out of the Blue it shuts down.  You can be typing away on your letter and loose about a half hour of work, this just happened to me.  If you can live with this its not that bad of a computer. I bought this computer for my job and I do a lot of writing and about once a week the thing I am working on disappears into thin air.I called ASUS about this and they want me to send them the computer so they can attempt to fix it.  A couple of weeks wihtout the computer is not possible because of work.  I think I will just have to live with this until I buy an HP or Dell to replace this unit.If you can live with the random shut downs and ASUS apathy to this problem its not a bad computer.  But before you purchase this unit Google " Assus Viviobook Random Shut Down". Good Luck!

Reviews.Title: Great at first, breaks down quickly
Reviews.Author: Connor
Reviews.Content: A few years ago I bought an ASUS netbook and loved the quality so much I decided to buy from them again when I needed a new laptop. The specs for the price seemed great, so I bought this one. For a while, the laptop worked great, it was quick and had no problems. Then came some issues:--random restarts--mouse multi-touch driver doesn't run after waking up from sleep (no way to start it manually)--wireless card is garbage (in places where I should have great reception, the wireless doesn't see or cannot connect to networks)--terrible placement of wireless card on motherboard--slows down considerably after a few months--keyboard takes ~5 minutes to use after reboot (after a few months)I would not buy this laptop again or recommend it to anyone, way too many problems and headaches.

Reviews.Title: Decent Ultrabook
Reviews.Author: McKee
Reviews.Content: I've had this laptop for about 3 months now, and have found it to be pretty decent. This computer allows me to do all I need to do whether is GIS, paper writing, or just playing games.Pros:-great keyboard and touchpad, I write a lot of papers and have never found any problems-charges very quickly-very fast start up-good for some gaming, I play Lord of the Rings Online with no issues, however some games may not run as well-I'm no audiophile but I find the speakers to be pretty good.-Asus service. I had a small issue with my laptop and Asus fixed the issue very quickly and even paid for expedited shippingCons-touchscreen occasionally stops working, fairly easy to fix-smart gesture (allows multi touch controls on the touchpad) occasionally stops working-wifi is not very good. I often have issues connecting at home, work, and university.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product
Reviews.Author: Rodriguez A. Alexis J.
Reviews.Content: Excelent it completes my expectatives I just add the backlight keyboard good performance smooth I like it the screen it's amazing good resolution

Reviews.Title: Completely unstable out of the box, but after re-installing the OS everything works good.
Reviews.Author: Terah Culp
Reviews.Content: Let first say that I love this computer it is thin and the aluminum case is really nice. After running it for just a few hours though I started running into problems. The computer was unstable. I looked in the event log and random processes were crashing. Some of the issues seemed to be with the MacAfee. I tried uninstalling that, but it didn't do a clean uninstall and left some windows services running even after uninstalling. At this point I decided to give it one more try and just start with a clean version of Windows 8.1 RTM. So far it has been running great without a single hiccup for the last 3 days. Also figuring out how to boot to a USB drive to re install is quite tricky too but some searching on Google revealed the magic BIOS settings to do that. So if you are thinking about getting this laptop, be ready to re-install everything.

Reviews.Title: Purchase ASUS VivoBook on Amazon.com
Reviews.Author: SueAnn Nguyen
Reviews.Content: I am very please with the ASUS VivoBook that I have purchased on Amazon.com.  It is a good product with a good price and fast shipping.

Reviews.Title: wifi drops out
Reviews.Author: Mike Carbone
Reviews.Content: Wifi drops out all the time, otherwise this would've been a decent notebook. Didn't happen until a few weeks after purchase.

Reviews.Title: ASUS continues to push poorly built product to meet demand
Reviews.Author: Mikky K
Reviews.Content: I purchased this laptop because my research indicated that this was going to be the best product at the price I wanted to pay.I opened the box and the touch screen didn't work.  After 24 hours of troubleshooting (on my own and with tech support) I exchanged it for another.I opened the box and the touch screen didn't work... again.  This time I bought from another company.  This is the third time I've purchased an ASUS product that didn't work out of the box.  My wife and I both bought (at the same time) ASUS tablets a year ago - both arrived with the same problem, they wouldn't turn on.  ASUS seems to have a habit of selling products (I suspect) they know are crap just to make the money up front and then once your committed, let you go through the pain of mailing off the faulty product for an exchange or fix.

Reviews.Title: gooooooood item
Reviews.Author: majed
Reviews.Content: thank you i love the item it is vary niceThaaaaannnnnnnnnnxxxxxxxxx for avery thing i hope you guys buy it

Reviews.Title: First and last order from amazon.com
Reviews.Author: VG
Reviews.Content: Made my first purchase from amazon.com after going through the reviews of the Asus Vivobook notebook. But alas, brand new laptop, just out of the box, is not working!!! Nothing is visible on the screen on trying to power on the machine but indicators are working fine which might mean some problem with the screen. I am very disappointed and helpless now as I ordered it to be delivered on a friend's US address as he was coming to India (I live in India) but now I don't know what to do with this crap as returning it back to US is not a viable option now.

Reviews.Title: Horrible computer to Complicated Locked me out!!!!
Reviews.Author: Gisele
Reviews.Content: This computer is way to complicated, be aware please only buy if you are savy computer geek... I will be returning this computer..
